Message.Title: CEO Dell owns 15.7 percent of the company, making it easier for firms to put together equity financing
Message.Msg: for the deal, one of the people said. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. upgraded the stock to buy in December, saying that Dell’s net cash balance presents an opportunity for a leveraged buyout. While demand for PCs has declined, Dell’s net cash balance of $5.15 billion provides “some downside buffer as it produces opportunity for an LBO or levered recap under the right conditions,” Bill Shope, an analyst at Goldman Sachs, wrote in the report. “Dell has become an attractive deep value play and we would be buyers of the stock.”

Message.Title: Software company Verisae sold to private equity firm
Message.Msg: Software company Verisae Inc. has been sold to private equity firm Marlin Equity Partners for an undisclosed amount. Minneapolis-based Verisae's technology allows companies to track energy use and monitor maintenance of equipment like refrigerators. The company targets the retail and grocery market, and counts companies like U.K.-based supermarket giant Tesco among its customers. Verisae has also used its software to track carbon footprints of major companies like Supervalu Inc. and Whole Foods. California-based Marlin Equity Partners has more than $1 billion in capital under management.

Message.Title: While people were buying
Message.Msg: calls, I was buying puts. There is no doubt that the rumors are most likely based on very preliminary "feeler" talks to gauge the possibility of privatization. But the result will be the realization (at least to PE) that getting it done entails too high of a risk. It's just putting too many eggs in one basket. Bottom line: There will be NO privatization Sell now BEFORE the masses do. It will happen. Dell will drop back to $11.

Message.Title: Remember the Old Days?
Message.Msg: We were all going to be dellionaires, remember? Remember Michael Dell, the boy genius? Didn't have a chair in his office, to busy and on the go. Those were the days of being naive and ignorant. Buy and hold for years, right you ole timers? I got the shaft big time and still paying the price, but I'm doing OK, no crying needed. It just shows you how things can change quickly and what is the real reason of investing. The purpose of investing is to make money. If you are not making money GET OUT, screw loyality, because your company that you had loyality too, will #$%$ in a second, along with their pundits, expert and surrogates. Companies are not out there to be loved, they are there to make money. Likewise, you put your hard earned money or parent's inheritance to make money as well. If you are not making money, you got to go back and figure out why. Screw your ego. Screw your hurt feelings. Sell and do more research on the companies you would like to invest in, whether they have thousands of people or 20. HEY DELL, don't let the door hit you on the #$%$ on the way out! So long, see you later Charly, good riddence, BYE BYE. HEY, Michael DELL is still very rich, good for him!

Topic.Title: Remember the Old Days?

Message.Msg: I agree with your comment...So stupid how a stock can go up 20% within seconds and basically increase a company within seconds but then drop 30% within a few hours. The Stock Market is nothing more then a big Casino. All the Stock market is trading wealth. If I buy a stock for $5, and you buy it for $6 and I sell mine at $6 I took your dollar and it goes back down to $5 is what it really is. I become $1 richer and your $1 poorer. They had top "winners" and "losers" billionaires who have made money - 1 was -45% and another was +46%....in lamest terms the one billioniare took the money of the other. It's stupid. Then you have a stock like amazon that is trading at 3,650 X it's earnings - YES 3 Thousand X it's earnings! Or Linkeden trading at 750X and at $115/share, but then you have Monster WorldWide trading at 10X and it's barley breaking $6. Or Ford trading at $13.50 and GM trading at $30 When GM filed for BK and Ford did not....Makes no sense.

Message.Title: Venture Capital mean death spiral for everyone
Message.Msg: Didnt anyone learn from the information overload of the last presidential election on venture capitalist? They do not add value, they remove value. The PC business is not a growth module, it is a commodity and Dell at #3 means they get a smaller portion of whatever is out there. Anyone who sees this stock at $12.50 should sell it all and get out because one of two things will happen. First, the VC will deep discount the actual value of the company and the stock and debt holders will get burned. Second, the buy on rumor and sell on news will tank this stock.

Topic.Title: The 9 billion in debt and commodity business prevents takeover

Message.Msg: Company had profits of $2.6 billion over past 12 months - that is after payments on debt. The $11 billion cash will make a buyout that much easier - that is money immediately available to pay back a portion of whatever PE firms lay out to do the deal. Speculation is that Michael would be part of the deal - thereby not needing extra funding for purchasing the 15% he holds. Bloomberg indicates 5 or 6 large banks have been approached for the financing to do the deal. I personally think this has a pretty good chance of happening. I remember when Michael made his last big purchases of the stock in March 2011 (price in the $14's) and he said that he was considering taking it private. You know nothing.

Message.Title: IS THIS NOT AN INSIDER INFORMATION LEAK?
Message.Msg: The news says in quotes: "The two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, confirming a Bloomberg report" Does this not merit a case for insider leak? These matters are obviously handled by a few people with knowledge that have to sign an agreement to keep quiet. How can they divulge secret confidential knowledge. This happens over and over again and SEC never regulates it. Obviously this was leaked out by some one who was privy to the information. In such cases of leak I say go after every one who had knowledge for breach of conduct and this is the only way we can stop insider trading. Subpeona Bloomberg and have them confirm who "with the knowledge of this information is" and put them in jail. These kind of insider information leak happens over and over again - I say go after all the option activity in the last few days and go after them and aggressively pursue a case.

Message.Title: Silver Lake, TPG Exploring Dell Bid.....Reuters
Message.Msg: Private-equity firms Silver Lake Partners and TPG have been in talks on the deal and could team on an offer, said people familiar with the matter. They added it’s possible that private-equity investors, such as pension funds, could invest alongside them. The people cautioned that a bidding group hadn’t been finalized and the situation was fluid. J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. is involved in the deal process, the people said. Several banks are in discussions about providing financing, they added.

Message.Title: DELL: Last Chance to Dump
Message.Msg: ell’s mean price target by analysts is only %11.96 and the 12% pop we have seen has shares up at $12.23. The market cap is $19 billion as of now. Dell has over $15 billion of short-term and long-term liquidity before getting into any receivables, inventory, and other current assets. We would caution that this is very much of a new rumor after an old rumor. To get a deal of this size done, it would require a huge consortium of private equity groups. Dell also has $5.3 billion in long-term debt and it lists another amount of close to $4.2 billion in “other” liabilities and almost $4 billion in deferred long-term liability charges. This would not be an easy deal to get done in raw financial terms die to the large size. Another issue is that even after the pop the $12.20 share price compares to a 52-week range of $8.69 to $18.36.

Topic.Title: Taking it private? Ok, who is that stupid.

Message.Msg: Don't be a fool..no one is buying Dell for their PCs.. its their server/storage/networking/cloud business... for example, RAX Raxkspace hosting uses Dell's equipment exclusively... and RAX trade at 9x sales... for just packaging DELL's cloud equipment and software..... DELL will offer a similar service "dell web hosting'.... DELL currently trades at .3x sales... better example JNR EMC trade over 2x sales.. storage and networking.. DELL is a steal..

Message.Title: Best of luck to all but just be careful. You don't have to look any further than Best Buy.

Message.Title: To all you little people...(suckers)
Message.Msg: Let me give you stock market 101. The way this works is the insiders retain a great deal of ownership, while selling out suckers like you on the cheap. Years from now the company will go public again in a better market at much higher price. They sell out leaving the next bunch of bag-holders waiting for a gain in maybe 20 years if you're lucky!
